body:
I'm not very excited about "Pizza", since it's not used in the standard library. But I do see how people can be confused by pi and PI, since they're also not real. Dang.

> Also, I don't think we should use all-caps names as examples.

I agree. All caps is used for acronyms, but not names as such.

It's a shame golint can't know programmatically what is an acronym or not; I've seen a fair number of all caps names that don't get flagged. https://github.com/golang/lint/blob/9bad2ac064ef73cba57dec90e67d45fec2ab67bc/lint.go#L539
